Package ca.hedlund.jpraat.binding.fon

Class Function

java.lang.Object
com.sun.jna.PointerType
ca.hedlund.jpraat.binding.sys.Thing
ca.hedlund.jpraat.binding.sys.Daata
ca.hedlund.jpraat.binding.fon.Function
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.sun.jna.NativeMapped, java.lang.AutoCloseable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AnyTier, IntervalTier, PointProcess, Sampled, TextGrid, TextInterval, TextTier
@Header("fon/Function.h")
public class Function
extends Daata
An object of type Function represents a function f (x, ...) on the domain [xmin, xmax] * .... Class invariants: xmax >= xmin; xmin, xmax are constant;

    • window

      public static double window​(double tim, int windowType)
      Return value: a number between 0 and 1, zero outside the "domain": domain [-0.5, 0.5]: rectangular, triangular, parabolic, hanning, hamming; domain [-0.77, 0.77]: potter, kaiser12; domain [-1, 1]: kaiser20; domain [-inf, +inf]: gaussian. Rectangular: 1; Triangular ("Parzen"): 1 - tim / 0.5 Parabolic ("Welch"): 1 - (tim / 0.5) ^ 2 Hanning (raised cosine): 0.5 + 0.5 * cos (2 * pi * tim) Hamming (raised cosine): 0.54 + 0.46 * cos (2 * pi * tim) Gaussian: exp (- (pi * tim) ^ 2) Kaiser12: besselI0 (12 * sqrt (1 - (tim / 0.77) ^ 2)) / besselI0 (12) Kaiser20: besselI0 (20.24 * sqrt (1 - tim ^ 2)) / besselI0 (20.24) Usage: the preferred window for almost every application is Kaiser20; its only shortcoming is the usual double computation time. Properties: Highest sidelobe: Rectangular: -10 dB Hanning: -30 dB Hamming: -40 dB Potter, Kaiser12: -90 dB Kaiser20: -180 dB Gaussian: -inf dB Height at 'tim' is +0.5 or -0.5 (limit from below): Rectangular: 1 Triangular, Parabolic, Hanning: 0 Hamming: 0.08 Gaussian: 0.085 Kaiser20: 0.0715 Potter: ... Area: Rectangular: 1 Parabolic: 2/3 Gaussian: 1 / sqrt (pi) Kaiser20: 0.9813318115591122859 / sqrt (pi) Hamming: 0.54 Triangular, Hanning: 1/2 Bandwidth (-20 dB): ...
